comment: The hardest part about this class was meeting the word count for the assigned papers. I actually found this class very interesting and appreciated the way she structured it. She was a very kind person and genuinely wanted to help students learn about the research writing process.

Since Jens was bound by the English department criteria, the class was kind of boring. Each paper had to be 2000 words, and while the prompts were pretty open-ended (general topic and students chose their own specific thing to write about), her grading was slow, responses vague, and lectures incredibly boring. She's also super quiet.
four papers that are 2000 words each. Class is very unorganized and she is very unclear. She is a very sweet lady, but I do not recommend taking her class.

2000 word long papers assigned every two weeks. Should be a easy A as long as you cite work in paper and correctly complete works cited page because it seems like that is the only thing she pays attention to. I submitted a paper that was almost 800 words under the minimum requirement and consisted of mostly quotes an I got a A.

If you aren't an English major (or other major that won't require a lot of writing), take her in a heartbeat. You won't learn anything in her class, but she is a  super easy grader - basically she just checks the citations and works cited page and skims through actual content. As long as you can put up with how random and boring she is, take her.

This woman is so loopy, it's insane. Her lectures could be over with in 15 minutes, but she drags it on for the entire 3 hours. We're always off topic. If attendance wasn't mandatory, I would hardly show up. The essay topics are ridiculous (i.e. quantum mechanics). It's impossible to get a 100. However, she grades like we're fourth graders (easy).

I literally don't understand how she is qualified to be a professor. She rambles on and on about pointless things and she makes no sense. She's quite the free spirit which can be interesting sometimes but she assigns five 2,000 word papers which is terrible and they're all about off the wall topics like quantum physics.

Yes, you do have to write a lot, but it's pretty easy when you can have the writing ability of a 4th grader and still make 95's. I was in her hybrid class and there are 3 papers, 2 of them were 2000 words and the other was 1500. She let us have a partner with one of the 2000 word papers. There's also a 5 min presentation.

I would not recommend taking Professor Jens class. She was very unorganized with the way she ran her class. After the second week what was on the syllabus was not relevant. She never updated it, and did not warn us about assignments until the class before they were due. She also did not provide much help, she never responded to any of her emails.

Professor Jens is an odd 1 but dont let her long stares intimidate you. I took her hybird class &the only assignments that were assigned:5 papers & maybe 3 online discussions. Not hard at all. She grades her papers a lot easier then she describes. Her flaws that bothered me were, She is unclear at times, & every time I emailed her she didnt respond
